column4: hey, right now im working with the LIve CD, after I installed the nVidia drivers via restricted driver manager my screen got black after the restart and now i cant do nuttin
is there a way for me to unable what i did?
I have ubuntu installed on my system, but after i installed the GEforce drivers my screen turned black and now i need to remove the option i did (Restricted Driver manager)
ok, but how can i undo what i did?
or i have to reinstall again?!
do you have a terminal?
you said you were using a live cd?
can you open the root folder of your installed system?
no just the drive you installed to
you should have a /media/sdaX (or more) icons on your desktop
if that is the only one, open it
you want to go to etc
and from etc you want to click on X11
so you should be at /media/sda1/etc/X11/
or something like that
open up the file xorg.conf
find the section labled 'device'
or you could dump the entire thing into the pastebin and i would fix it
xorg.conf that is
then you need to log in as root.
open a terminal
type 'gksu <what the file mananger you use is>'
